column5: So cute, Tuxception!

I‚Äôve been codependent like this in the past and have had it done to me as well and yeah it‚Äôs exhausting. I think sometimes that happens bc you start a relationship by getting to know someone and are in contact maybe a lot and then it sort of sets the expected tone, so when that contact tapers it‚Äôs perhaps confusing. I‚Äôm finding ideally I would check in with whomever and chat a little throughout the day but mostly lead my own life. I think otherwise a lot of contact with no substance and just attention feels sorta unhealthily codependent. Also finding people
Who are okay with sitting with themselves and not needing attention constantly. sorta rambling sorry but I‚Äôve been thinking about this a lot lately as I‚Äôve had a hard time w it in the past. I hope you find someone who fits the bill

I‚Äôm really sorry this is happening to you- it‚Äôs really difficult to trust and confide in people, especially about sensitive topics like mental health. Them using that against you is extremely not ok. I hope you can stay strong and not relapse- try to remind yourself that 6 months clean is amazing!! If there is a way to tell those people that their behavior is causing you harm and set boundaries, I would encourage that
First, You‚Äôre not bothering anyone at all! Second, 96 days is huge! Congratulations it‚Äôs really amazing and I hope you get to 5 months. I believe in you!!

I can't even imagine how you must feel right now. You don't have to be sorry for feeling upset, it's an upsetting situation and you're allowed to feel your feelings! I wish the circumstances were that you could be sad in peace but proud of you trucking on. I'm sorry that you had to rehome your dog but hopefully he's in an equally loving home now.
Seriously so Beautifully written, thank you for sharing!! And I appreciated the tips at the end and it feels so nice to know others feel the same. You put it into words really well

I feel like this a lot! It‚Äôs difficult. I like to remind myself that, like with most urges, in due time it‚Äôll pass. It‚Äôs hard but try not to feed the urges‚Äô Fire, try to treat it like a wave that‚Äôll eventually flow back. If you can, try to distract yourself with things like music or watching something to take your mind off the urge
Hi I see you, i notice you, and I‚Äôm so sorry about all the pain you‚Äôve endured. You don‚Äôt deserve to feel so badly. I hope things get better for you, we‚Äôre here to support you

I‚Äôm really happy you‚Äôre still here. I struggle a lot w suicidal ideation and so even though I don‚Äôt really like the idea of it being seen as selfish I‚Äôm glad you thought about your bf and it helped. He loves you and so do lots of others in your life. I‚Äôm really glad you‚Äôll be able to hopefully talk to someone! ‚ô•Ô∏è
You did really good, the last line is somehow both surprising & fitting and gets‚Äô me every time

Do your kids want you to have fun with them or can tell that you‚Äôre stressed and want you to have fun for yourself? 
If the former, perhaps there are things that you, your partner and kids can all lightheartedly enjoy and have fun doing. Making time to do fun things is important, sometimes just as important as work. 
If the latter- I think its sweet that your kids want you to have fun. Remember that your kids want you to be happy and it‚Äôs coming from a place of love and not criticism. I know when one has a lot of responsibilities it‚Äôs really hard to be fun. I know. But doing fun things, having fun is good for the soul and benefits everyone in your life. You deserve to have fun!! 
Lastly, try not to beat yourself up if you can‚Äôt be ‚Äúfun‚Äù in the typical way. What is considered fun is different for everyone. Try to find things you enjoy and make you happy and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll benefit you, your partner and your kids as well.

I kno that initial relapse feels awful but it doesn't undo those 10 months and it's amazing that you are 4 months clean!! It does get easier. I am having a hard moment right now and that is a nice reminder, thank you

That's awesome!! Proud of you. I love angel food cake- i love how it's so soft lol
Wow I love this!! It looks beautiful :)
I am so sorry you're feeling like this. I know things can be really difficult but there are reasons to hang in there. If you need to talk, you can talk to me

My first go to is taking a hot shower. Walking/running/exercising and making art (painting, scribbling with crayons, cutting things for collages, drawing lines and other simple doodles) has been very helpful to me as well. I also like to remind myself that if I don't hold on to the urge, then hopefully it will pass in due time. It always does and then I feel proud for not giving in

Of course!! So wonderful about your job/health insurance. You shouldn't beat yourself up over that, it's really hard getting started on this sort of thing. It's a lot! Good luck with everything and, again, you can always reach out. promise you're not alone

Hi, first, I just want to say that I'm really proud of you for taking the steps to try to heal. That sort of work is really difficult but so important and worth it. You deserve to lead a life where you feel happy and safe and have meaningful relationships.

The exercise you're speaking about in the second paragraph is called "Life-Mapping." Here are some links to get started on that:

[https://www.mycallingiq.com/the-life-map-exercise/](https://www.mycallingiq.com/the-life-map-exercise/)

[Life Mapping](http://static1.squarespace.com/static/52a59879e4b04ff3be08d909/t/57845718e3df287846935d1e/1468290841160/Life+Mapping+Tool.pdf)

[https://ccojubilee.org/am-site/media/life-mapping-exercise.pdf](https://ccojubilee.org/am-site/media/life-mapping-exercise.pdf) (this one has a religious component, which you can ignore if you want to lol)

[http://www.tcpc.org.au/images/docs/Life%20Map%20Instructions.pdf](http://www.tcpc.org.au/images/docs/Life%20Map%20Instructions.pdf)

There are many different approaches to the exercise, so you can google if none of the above seem to work for you and find one that does or maybe even combine a few. Your Life Map, your rules!

Second, it's really great you're reading up and trying to figure things out. I am not too familiar with attachment styles (I believe I am anxious preoccupied, which means hey we seek each other out!)  so I can't offer further advice about that but I think continuing to read and trying to parse out things that are applicable to you is a wonderful start. I know it probably seems daunting to do so. Here are some links about altering your attachment style:

[https://psychcentral.com/lib/how-to-change-your-attachment-style/](https://psychcentral.com/lib/how-to-change-your-attachment-style/)

[https://www.psychalive.org/change-attachment-style-better-life/](https://www.psychalive.org/change-attachment-style-better-life/)

[https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-develop-a-secure-attachment-style](https://www.mindbodygreen.com/articles/how-to-develop-a-secure-attachment-style)

The last bit of this article I like, "Insight means realizing why things worked out as they did, why you are how you are, why they were how they were. It's not about making excuses for anyone. It's about assessing the depths and locations of the scars in your inner landscape so you don't keep falling into those same patterns for the rest of your life." 

A lot of these articles suggest therapy as well. I know that sort of thing is a privilege but if you are able to swing it, that could be very beneficial in understanding yourself more and changing the parts that you would like to. 

I don't know how helpful the above will be but I hope it helps a bit. I want to just say again that I am proud of you for wanting change and wanting to find the light in the darkness. I know you can be happier and more fulfilled, it just takes time and effort. You got this. You can message me if you ever need to talk or vent, I will try to be there for you

Hi buttercup- if you still need someone to speak to you can message me. I struggle with the same issues and it‚Äôs really really difficult and makes life unbearable sometimes. I know it‚Äôs hard but you‚Äôre not alone! Not at all!! You are strong and loved and though we don‚Äôt know one another, I care about you so much. Feel free to message me!
